fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38975].
  {panel}

I was preparing a set of filters with dedicated Columns Layout.
And thinking that I was modifying the Columns Layout of the new filter, I have modified the "My Default" Columns Layout.

After having shared with the team, I had pain to understand what was the cause of this miss of Column Layout in my filter.
I have understood my error only after some debug and some SQL queries.

In order to avoid that, it will be practice to have the below behavior :
* When using a JQL query not saved as filter, only "My Default" Column Layout should be available (also System in case of Administrator)
* When using one of My Filter , only "Filter" Column Layout should be available

V.
fields.summary: It is not easy to identify the scope of Columns Layout (My, Filter or System) in Issue Navigator.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38953].
  {panel}

Currently, when you have an issue *Issue_A* which is linked to two other issues *Issue_B* and *Issue_C*. And you clone the three issues *A*, *B*, and *C* and move them to another project, the issues will maintain the same links with the original issues.

In some cases, it will be really helpful if the behaviour was changed to make those cloned issues to link to each other instead of linking to the original issues. An example use case of this would be as follows:
* Standard project for all test issues including dependencies (e.g. issues 1, 7 and 5 must pass before issue 10 can be tested)
* Those dependencies are described as issue links (e.g. issue 10 has links to issues 1, 7 and 5)
* Clone and move a subset of the test issues to a specific project xy.
* Cloned and moved test issues in the specific project xy are linked to its dependent issues (links point to the issues in project xy, NOT to issues in standard project)
fields.summary: Change the relation links between issues
Upgrade jira to atlassian-gzip in version 1.21 for performance improvements

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38947].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

When on the dashboard, if there are a large number of favourited dashboards the scrollbar disappears.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Favourite a large number of dashboards (more than appear on the screen).
# View the dashboard.
# Attempt to scroll to view the dashboards that are not shown.

h3. Expected Results

There is some way of accessing them (either via scrollbar or other UI magic).

h3. Actual Results

The dashboards do not appear.

h3. Workaround

Reduce the amount of favourited dashboards.
fields.summary: When a user has a large or extended amount of favourited dashboards there is no scroll bar

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38946].
  {panel}

So, I use the JDK for all installs, most users I have also use this, the JDK comes with a jaxb reference impl as part of tools.jar.  The JIRA installer ships with a JRE lacking tools.jar.  This means users who using the installer encounter runtime exceptions if addons used JAXB and didn't _add_ their own implementation jar.

- https://thepluginpeople.atlassian.net/browse/JEMH-2544

Bamboo had the same thing: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BAM-12484

It would be 'useful' if the JRE bundled with the JIRA installer had the referred JAXB impl jar.

I've added this into my addon, however, users upgrading are in a catch22, as it breaks startup _before_ they can upgrade.
fields.summary: JIRA installer ships with JRE, lacking JAXB default implementation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38928].
  {panel}

On both the Burndown Chart report in the Agile boards and the "Agile Sprint Burndown Gadget" on the Dashboards, the "Remaining Values" line is showing misleading information. 

I've configured my boards to use the "Remaining Estimate and Time Spent" setting, which is described as: "Track time against issues using JIRA's Remaining Estimate and Time Spent fields. *The Burndown Chart will be based on these two values.*"

However, when I look at the "Remaining Values" line on the burndown charts, I'm not seeing the sum of the remaining estimates field as expected. I'm pretty sure I'm instead seeing the "original estimate" minus the "time spent" field. 

I've attached a picture showing the burndown for tasks assigned to one of my users and the difference this can make. On the left, the chart filters out any closed tasks (which have their remaining estimates at 0, since no work effort remains) and only sums the remaining estimates of open or in-progress tasks. On the right, the filter is simply assignee=KB, and it shows over 100 additional hours. 

_(By way of explanation, this user was assigned a few tasks that were overflow when others needed to adjust their sprint commitments due to scope creep. These may have had large original estimates but the remaining effort was much less, as you can see in the charts.)_

Without getting into discussions about how we use the remaining estimate field and whether or not to update it, the issue is that in the Agile board's configuration settings, I'm lead to believe that the red "Remaining Values" line represents the sum of the "remaining estimates" field, which it is not, and should be.
fields.summary: Sprint Burndown Gadgets showing misleading "remaining values"
Update Tomcat Native DLL in JIRA Installer

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38916].
  {panel}

The Date Time Picker defaults to current time.

As requestor could fill out unknowingly, then the assignee assumes it's intentional.

In many cases you might want to allow it to be set, but it's better to assume 00:00:00 if not manually touched.

UI should be changed to not display hh:mm:ss when 00:00:00. 

Like a 'Went Live Date' is probably the time you're in the ticket adjusting (some may not have access to see your source code pushing) but a 'Want Live Date' might be ok with just the day, and if you want more specific set the time.

CUSTOMFIELDTYPEKEY
com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:datetime.autotime
or
com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:datetime.noautotime

Personally I'd change the behavior of datetime, and rollout a upgrade step to convert all datetime to date.autotime in existing installation databases.

Maybe even a button for 'insert current time' in the pop-up picker.

If debating defaults is a lengthily affair a new datetime.noautotime is cool.
fields.summary: Date Time custom field type auto time behavior

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38914].
  {panel}

Easy toggle of custom field Date Picker format (date vs date+time) from UI

Having to go change the database OR making a new custom field and migrating OR changing look and feel to hide/show if ok toggling them all seems silly.

customfield might have
com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:datepicker
com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:daterange

But customfieldvalue always has the time anyways:
YYYY-MM-DD 00:00:00
`DATEVALUE` datetime DEFAULT NULL,

You can adjust the database to:
com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:datetime
com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:datetimerange 

Where in the UI would you go to change? Custom fields > edit > just beneath Search Template. Maybe call it Field Type Template. 

Could be re-used later for other easy switches https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Changing+Custom+Field+Types

---

Speaking of which (probably need to make new tickets for it):

The Date Time Picker defaults to current time. (In some cases you might want to allow it to be set, but assume 00:00:00 if not manually set.

Like a 'Went Live Date' is probably the time you're in the ticket adjusting, but a 'Want Live Date' might be ok with just the day, and if you want more specific set the time.
com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:datetime.autotime 

Would be nice if the built-in Due Date system field would allow time (it's stored same way in jiraissue), but default to 00:00:00 and not shown in UI unless filled out as well.
fields.summary: Toggle of custom field Date Picker format (date vs date+time) from UI

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38888].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
If a user tries to load JIRA gadget directory, the operation take a long time (up to a minute) to complete. It also causes a CPU usage spike, and affects the overall JIRA instance performance.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In a JIRA instance with multiple users, create or configure a dashboard. 
# Click *Add gadget* to display the gadget directory.

h3. Expected Results
The gadget directory loads without issues and all gadgets are displayed.

h3. Actual Results
The operation takes a long time, and consumes excessive CPU resources. This puts pressure on the whole instance, affecting other users that may be attempting to load other JIRA screens. 
In some cases pages fail to load altogether with an error:
{quote}Page unavailable
The requested page failed to load. If the problem persists, please contact Atlassian Cloud Support.{quote}

h3.Workaround
There is no workaround for this issue, although a later attempt to load the gadget directory may succeed if some of the data has been cached.
fields.summary: Loading JIRA gadget directory will cause CPU usage to spike, take long to load and all users will get affected

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38854].
  {panel}

Say you're dealing with a multi-line text field like the built-in Description.

some text (line1)

(line2 empty)

more text (line3)


If you edit the Description Line:

In the text email breaks are respected in the top changed area.

However, in the text email summary area it's compressed.


Using noformat or similar markup makes no difference.

issuesummary.vm uses
$!{velocityhelper.quote($!issue.description)}

and could use a getString("description") there (or some new helper might already exist to respect line break) http://wiki.apache.org/velocity/VelocityWhitespaceGobbling

Or at least if the line breaks / whitespace got converted into > (greater than symbol).
Why convert? Because Jira built-in mail handler has two modes strip quotes or strip after marker. (Add converting would keep strip quotes working).
fields.summary: Allow Text Email Line Break / Whitespace in issuesummary.vm

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

The Kammalou Agile Workflow V1.0 (found at https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/kammalou.com.agile) is incomplete, it's post functions don't:

# change the issue status
# update issue history
# fire events

As a result it's essentially a useless workflow. This should be removed from the workflow importer until it works properly.
fields.summary: Remove 'Kammalou Agile Workflow V1.0' from JIRA's workflow importer

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38844].
  {panel}

The JIRA import wizard should include a page notifying a user of any custom field values, resolutions, statuses and etc that will be created or added to JIRA during an import.

Example, https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-18480.

JIRA export adds Unresolved to any issue that is not resolved.  If the issues are imported back into JIRA a new Unresolved resolution will be created.  Previous JIRA issues states that this issue is "Won't Fix", JRA-18480.

It would be helpful during the import process a page showed exactly what new custom field values, resolutions, statuses and any other added values that will be created during the import.  In addition a checkbox should placed next to the value to be added so the user can decide to check/uncheck the box if they want the value to be added to JIRA.
fields.summary: Include notice of any items that will be created during a JIRA project import

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38832].
  {panel}

login failure via external directories does not provide reason why the login failed and this is causing really big problem in corporate environments.

We tested this and this doesn't work neither with LDAP or Crowd. We are using Crowd so probably this will have to be implemented in both JIRA and Crowd.

{noformat}
--- account with invalid password
ldap_bind: Invalid credentials (49)
	additional info: 80090308: LdapErr: DSID-0C0903A8, 
comment: AcceptSecurityContext error, data 52e, v1db1

--- account with password expired
ldap_bind: Invalid credentials (49)
	additional info: 80090308: LdapErr: DSID-0C0903A8, 
comment: AcceptSecurityContext error, data 532, v1db1

--- disabled account
(TBD)

--- locked account
(TBD)
{noformat}

Note: the LDAP server being used is Microsoft Active Directory. Return codes are valid for all versions and seem to be similar across all LDAP servers.



525	user not found
52e	invalid credentials
530	not permitted to logon at this time
531	not permitted to logon at this workstation
532	password expired
533	account disabled
701	account expired
773	user must reset password
775	user account locked
fields.summary: login failure via external directories does not provide reason
Support for Oracle 12c database in JIRA

fields.description: {panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa} *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38827]. {panel} When adding values for a multi-select field, there is a suggestion that you can use HTML tags to make the values bold or colored or whatever. I have done this to some of my multi-select fields, and this has broken filters that were looking for them. Previously I had values "regression" and "degradation", which I changed to "regression" and "degradation". Now any filters that are looking for degradation or regression are broken. Instead I have to change the filters to include the HTML tags. What's more, the Basic filter creator will no longer work with this field, instead you have to use JQL when doing filters. This rather makes the ability to add HTML tags useless, as it makes it very difficult for the average user to filter on these fields now. The suggested fix is to only parse the HTML tags when displaying the multi-select field, but to strip it out for filtering purposes.
fields.summary: Putting HTML tags into multi-select options interferes with filtering

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38816].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce:
# install JIRA 6.2.x
# create a project .Eg: project FE
# create multiple users. Eg: *userA*,*userB*
# granted only "userA" to the Edit Issue permission in the project "FE"
# create new issue in project FE and add table into the Description field. Eg:
{code}
|| Food || Description || Colour||
| JIRA|  JIRA is the tracker for teams planning and building great products. Thousands of teams choose JIRA to capture and organize issues, assign work, and follow team activity | Blue|
|Confluence  | Give your team one place to share, find, and collaborate on information they need to get work done. | Blue|
| Bamboo| Bamboo does more than just run builds and tests. It connects issues, commits, test results, and deploys so the whole picture is available to your entire product team – from project managers, to devs and testers, to sys admins.  |Blue |
{code}
# (BUG)access the issue as "userA" using Google Chrome and the Description field appear as in ViewIssue.png

Notes:
* accessing the same issue as "userB" will shows the content nicely
* "userA" does not experience the same problem if accessing JIRA using other browser like Firefox. 

This is so far tested with:
* JIRA 6.2.2, JIRA 6.2.7
* Chrome 35.0.x
fields.summary: Description table did not render table content nicely when viewed using Chrome

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38815].
  {panel}

I'm using jira-cli-3.9.0.jar to export some information for issues in a csv format. I'm filtering the appropriate issues and at some point I started getting error like this:

Remote error: Could not find or access issue with key: XXXX. Details: org.xml.sax.SAXParseException; lineNumber: 1; columnNumber: 1; Premature end of file.
java.rmi.RemoteException: Could not find or access issue with key: NEE-3301. Details: org.xml.sax.SAXParseException; lineNumber: 1; columnNumber: 1; Premature end of file.

I did some investigation and it appeared that just one issue, which falls in the filter is breaking the entire operation. The reason is a character in the description - if I delete it all works fine. I'm not sure where it came from, but here it's copy pasted - '', so in order to reproduce the problem just try to use the jira-cli to retrieve this current issue.
fields.summary: Special character in description breaks Jira CLI

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38814].
  {panel}

The Workflow Properties of {{jira.field.resolution.exclude}} is working properly to exclude a particular Resolution to be showing in the select list for Resolution field.

However, when clicking on the Help Menu for Resolution field, it will listed a resolution which has been excluded using the Workflow properties.

h4. Steps to reproduce
# In fresh install, add new Resolution name "Completed"
# Create DEMO project
# Edit classic workflow
# Add workflow properties of {{jira.field.resolution.exclude}} with value 10000 in 'Resolve Issue' transition at status 'Open'
# Open DEMO project and switch scheme to use Classic workflow scheme
# Open DEMO-1 and try Resolve Issue - "Completed" won't be showing but clicking on the Help Menu will list it

h4. Expected Behaviour
The expected behaviour would be, excluding the resolution using Workflow properties should exclude it from both select list and Help menu to have better consistency.
fields.summary: Workflow Properties jira.field.resolution.exclude to also Exclude Information in Help Menu

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38800].
  {panel}

Description:
Our plugin extends / overrides the CreateWorklog action and - in addition - exchanges the view (original view was: /secure/views/issue/logwork.jsp from actions.xml)
Extract from atlassian-plugin.xml:
{code:xml}
<webwork1 key="ictime-extended-worklog" class="java.lang.Object">
    <actions>
      <action name="de.iconcept.ictime.actions.timeentry.ExtendedCreateTimeEntry" alias="CreateWorklog">
        <view name="input">/templates/ictime-webwork-module/extendedCreateEntry.vm</view>
        <view name="error">/templates/ictime-webwork-module/extendedCreateEntry.vm</view>
        <view name="invalidlicense">/templates/ictime-webwork-module/invalidLicense.vm</view>
        <view name="invalidJiraVersion">/templates/ictime-webwork-module/invalidJiraVersion.vm</view>
        <view name="securitybreach">/secure/views/securitybreach.jsp</view>
      </action>
    </actions>
  </webwork1>
{code}

If you click on the "Log Work" action within an issue, it happens - on customer installations - that an IllegalArgumentException is thrown:

{code}
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: name
        at sun.misc.URLClassPath$Loader.findResource(URLClassPath.java:494)
        at sun.misc.URLClassPath.findResource(URLClassPath.java:176)
        at java.net.URLClassLoader$2.run(URLClassLoader.java:551)
        at java.net.URLClassLoader$2.run(URLClassLoader.java:549)
        at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)
        at java.net.URLClassLoader.findResource(URLClassLoader.java:548)
        at org.apache.catalina.loader.WebappClassLoader.findResource(WebappClassLoader.java:1267)
        at org.apache.catalina.loader.WebappClassLoader.getResource(WebappClassLoader.java:1408)
        at com.atlassian.core.util.ClassLoaderUtils.getResource(ClassLoaderUtils.java:113)
        at com.atlassian.velocity.DefaultVelocityManager.exceptionHandling(DefaultVelocityManager.java:137)
        at com.atlassian.velocity.DefaultVelocityManager.writeEncodedBodyImpl(DefaultVelocityManager.java:123)
        at com.atlassian.velocity.DefaultVelocityManager.writeEncodedBody(DefaultVelocityManager.java:97)
        at com.atlassian.jira.template.velocity.DefaultVelocityTemplatingEngine$DefaultRenderRequest.toWriterImpl(DefaultVelocityTemplatingEngine.java:146)
        at com.atlassian.jira.template.velocity.DefaultVelocityTemplatingEngine$DefaultRenderRequest.asHtml(DefaultVelocityTemplatingEngine.java:134)
        at com.atlassian.jira.web.dispatcher.JiraVelocityViewDispatcher.dispatch(JiraVelocityViewDispatcher.java:50)
        at com.atlassian.jira.web.dispatcher.JiraWebworkViewDispatcher.dispatchViaVelocityView(JiraWebworkViewDispatcher.java:110)
        at com.atlassian.jira.web.dispatcher.JiraWebworkViewDispatcher.dispatchView(JiraWebworkViewDispatcher.java:69)
        at com.atlassian.jira.web.dispatcher.JiraWebworkActionDispatcher.service(JiraWebworkActionDispatcher.java:204)
{code}

From atlassian-jira.log:
{code}
2014-06-10 12:03:05,806 http-bio-8443-exec-61 ERROR earagones 723x176214x1 9cj4er 127.0.0.1 /secure/CreateWorklog!default.jspa [velocity] ResourceManager : unable to find resource 'de.iconcept.ictime.jira-ictime:ictime-extended-worklog//secure/views/issue/logwork.jsp' in any resource loader.
{code}

This means, that the webwork plugin from jira tried to find the original logwork.jsp in our plugin code instead of using the original jsp provided by jira OR taking the overriden velocity view defined in the atlassian-plugin.xml.

Enabling / disabling the plugin does not solves the problem. We are not able to reproduce the problem, but it happens frequently on customer sites installing our plugin.
fields.summary: Webwork module resource lookup sometimes failing
Add additional JQL functions for sub-task queries
List down inactive or no longer used filter
"Create and New" button
Investigate browse project issue in cluster performance tests: "tabHtml" undefined in soy template

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38788].
  {panel}

Update/workaround: 
I can create the pie chart after changing to Statistic Type = Reporter, and this generates the data matching that for "Creator" in the filter results view.

I can add a "Filter Results" gadget to a dashboard for a saved query to find open bugs created this week.

However, when I try to add a pie chart that displays the results of this filter by creator, an internal server error results. Note that the same pie chart works when I select parameters other than Creator as the Statistic Type.

Screen shot attached, showing the failed pie chart on the left and the successful filter results on the right.

This is the query:
issuetype = Bug AND (createdDate >= -6d OR status in (open, reopened) AND resolved >= -6d) AND resolution = Unresolved ORDER BY creator
fields.summary: Dashboard gadget: Cannot add a pie chart of recent bugs by creator to a dashboard.
Background re-index does not take a (read) lock on the index and this allows a foreground re-index to start while the background re-index is still running.
The start sprint button is hard to find
JIRA Admin Helper needs to be more clear about context in the "Where's my field?" functionality.
Duplicate entries when jira is connected to stash and fisheye

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38776].
  {panel}

From JIRA, go to More > Link > Confluence page
Insert a link using url encoding (such as https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/%27The+project+you+are+trying+to+view+does+not+exist%27+Error+Message+Due+to+Project+Key+Pattern).

*Expected result*
* Receive an authentication dance  for the Confluence instanced linked to the JIRA instance
* If the page exists, display the page and complete the link.
* If the page does not exist, display a "No page found" message

*Actual result*
* Directly receive an authentication dance  for Confluence within the same frame
* The link button becomes greyed out
* No changes can be performed on the window any more, in order to make changes, the Link frame has to get pulled up fresh again.

Tested and confirmed in a test environment and JAC/CAC
fields.summary: Confluence page link plugin unable to interpret url encoding
Could Jira importer stamp a web link to the new JIRA issue on the source system
Transition from All to Custom in Issue create form will reset temporary attachments

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38768].
  {panel}

I want to convert "story" to "epic" so that I can convert the "subtasks" to "tasks" so that I can assign the tasks to different sprints.

I find I have to do alot of clicking to make this happen:

1. select the subtask
2. more -> convert to issue
3. select "task"
4. click 3 times
5. click "edit"
6. Assign the "epic link"

Now do this for all the 20 other subtasks.  It would be better if I could do this with fewer clicks.
fields.summary: Make it easier to convert "subtasks" to "tasks"
Update JIRA MISC Workflow Extension in JIRA OnDemand

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38764].
  {panel}

Steps:
- In your system, create a custom checkbox field "abc"
- Add a two dimensional chart to the dashboard. Let's say the JQL is "status=open" in the filter
- Choose X axis = "abc'
- Y axis, any field. Let's say it is Assignee
- You will get an X axis column named "None". In there it will show it has data

Error:
- When you click on the link of the "value" show in "none", you get the JQL  like "status = open AND assignee = admin AND abc is EMPTY". It shows you there are 0 results which is different from what the chart displays.
fields.summary: [Two dimensional chart] If we use a custom field, the "none" column link will be incorrect

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38763].
  {panel}

Steps:
- Add a two dimensional chart gadget to the dashboard
- Edit it, leave field "number of results" empty and click save

Error:
- It shows an error message that the number of results must be 1<x<50. However, in actual reality you can enter more than 50 and the validation is not enforced.
fields.summary: Two dimensional chart gadget does not enforce number of results constraint
Browse Group to Add Directory Column

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38753].
  {panel}

*Current:*
The refresh-page functionality is available next to the footer summary of a search result:
!search_refresh_page.jpg|thumbnail!

*Improvement:*
Include the functionality at the top summary of the search result

*Usage Case:*
Improved usability when a search results returns a high volume of issues.  This improvement would prevent the need to scroll and then refresh.
fields.summary: Include 'refresh-table' functionality next to top summary of list view within JIRA search

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38752].
  {panel}

Dragons Docs Stage 6 Step 1. Link FishEye and JIRA is an erroneous step in this tutorial.

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/ATLAS/Dragons+Stage+6+-+Get+JIRA+and+FishEye+Talking

This suggest to create an app link, but this already exists. 
The right step by step is:
{quote}
    Click on 'Administration'
    Click on 'Repositories'
    For the 'Dragons' repository click on the 'Cog' to the righthand side and click 'Application Links'
    Click on 'Add Link' and select the Global Application link you configured to for Fisheye to JIRA
    Then enter :
        'DRA' for the Key
        Select 'Yes, create a link from JIRA Project Dragons to Repository Dragons as well.'
        Click 'Create'
{quote}
fields.summary: Dragons Docs Stage 6 Ammendments
The DBCP pool-test-on-borrow parameter should explicitly be set to false on the dbconfig.xml file

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38750].
  {panel}

The [Tuning Database Connections|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Tuning+Database+Connections] document states the following on the {{pool-test-on-borrow}} parameter:
{quote}
*Recommendation / Notes*
This value should always be 'false' as JIRA borrows a connection for each database operation.

(/) If you continue to have problems with database connections closing, try setting this option to 'true'. However, this should only be used as a last resort and only in the event that decreasing the value of *Time Between Eviction Runs* has not reduced or prevented problems with database connections closing.

*Default value*
false
(when not specified in dbconfig.xml)
{quote}

However, looking into the [Apache DBCP Documentation|http://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-dbcp/configuration.html], we can see that the default value for this option is *true*:
{quote}
|| Parameter || Default || Description ||
| (...) | (...) | (...) |
| testOnBorrow | true | The indication of whether objects will be validated before being borrowed from the pool. If the object fails to validate, it will be dropped from the pool, and we will attempt to borrow another.|
{quote}

This means that the validation query is executed *every time a connection is borrowed from the pool*.

I have confirmed this behaviour by enabling SQL logging on PostgreSQL and confirming the validation query was executed every time a query was triggered from JIRA. 

We should review our documents which provide a sample {{dbconfig.xml}} with a validation query, as this parameter (<pool-test-on-borrow>) should be explicitly declared as *false* in those examples:
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Connecting+JIRA+to+PostgreSQL
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Connecting+JIRA+to+SQL+Server+2008
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Connecting+JIRA+to+Oracle
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Connecting+JIRA+to+MySQL
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Surviving+Connection+Closures

I will also update the [Tuning Database Connections|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Tuning+Database+Connections] document to correct parameter value there.
fields.summary: Review all DB configuration documents regarding the Test On Borrow parameter

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38746].
  {panel}

Hi,

I'm using Cluster Messaging Service in order to propagate messages through my cluster.
When I'm re-installing the plugin I'm getting following exception:

2014-06-13 15:18:41,844 ClusterMessageHandlerServiceThread:thread-1 ERROR      [atlassian.jira.cluster.OfBizMessageHandlerService] There was a problem
 handling a cluster message
org.springframework.osgi.service.importer.ServiceProxyDestroyedException: service proxy has been destroyed
        at org.springframework.osgi.service.importer.support.internal.aop.ServiceDynamicInterceptor$ServiceLookUpCallback.doWithRetry(ServiceDynamicIn
terceptor.java:105)
        at org.springframework.osgi.service.importer.support.internal.support.RetryTemplate.execute(RetryTemplate.java:83)
        at org.springframework.osgi.service.importer.support.internal.aop.ServiceDynamicInterceptor.lookupService(ServiceDynamicInterceptor.java:430)
        at org.springframework.osgi.service.importer.support.internal.aop.ServiceDynamicInterceptor.getTarget(ServiceDynamicInterceptor.java:415)
        at org.springframework.osgi.service.importer.support.internal.aop.ServiceInvoker.invoke(ServiceInvoker.java:62)
        at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:171)
        at org.springframework.aop.support.DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.doProceed(DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.java:131)
        at org.springframework.aop.support.DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.invoke(DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.java:119)
        at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:171)
        at org.springframework.osgi.service.util.internal.aop.ServiceTCCLInterceptor.invokeUnprivileged(ServiceTCCLInterceptor.java:56)
        at org.springframework.osgi.service.util.internal.aop.ServiceTCCLInterceptor.invoke(ServiceTCCLInterceptor.java:39)
        at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:171)
        at org.springframework.osgi.service.importer.support.LocalBundleContextAdvice.invoke(LocalBundleContextAdvice.java:59)
        at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:171)
        at org.springframework.aop.support.DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.doProceed(DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.java:131)
        at org.springframework.aop.support.DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.invoke(DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.java:119)
        at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:171)
        at org.springframework.aop.framework.JdkDynamicAopProxy.invoke(JdkDynamicAopProxy.java:204)
        at com.sun.proxy.$Proxy2799.get(Unknown Source)
        at pl.com.tt.thescheduler.model.dao.ScheduledIssueDaoImpl.read(ScheduledIssueDaoImpl.java:281)
        at pl.com.tt.thescheduler.core.TheSchedulerServiceImpl.scheduleIssue(TheSchedulerServiceImpl.java:197)
        at pl.com.tt.thescheduler.core.TheSchedulerServiceImpl$MessageConsumer.receive(TheSchedulerServiceImpl.java:629)
        at com.atlassian.jira.cluster.OfBizMessageHandlerService.sendLocalFromNode(OfBizMessageHandlerService.java:259)
        at com.atlassian.jira.cluster.OfBizMessageHandlerService.handleReceivedMessages(OfBizMessageHandlerService.java:152)
        at com.atlassian.jira.cluster.OfBizMessageHandlerService.access$000(OfBizMessageHandlerService.java:33)
        at com.atlassian.jira.cluster.OfBizMessageHandlerService$1.run(OfBizMessageHandlerService.java:58)
        at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:439)
        at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask$Sync.innerRunAndReset(FutureTask.java:317)
        at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.runAndReset(FutureTask.java:150)
        at java.util.concurrent.ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor$ScheduledFutureTask.access$101(ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor.java:98)
        at java.util.concurrent.ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor$ScheduledFutureTask.runPeriodic(ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor.java:180)
        at java.util.concurrent.ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor$ScheduledFutureTask.run(ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor.java:204)
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.runTask(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:895)
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:918)
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:662)

Is there any known solution for that? Should I implement something in different way.

The JIRA version I'm using is 6.3-m05.
fields.summary: Problem handling cluster message
